The Board is responsible for the governance of risk. The Board should ensure that the Management maintains a sound system of risk management and internal controls to safeguard shareholders interest and the Companyâ€™s assets, and should determine the nature and the extent of the significant risks which the board is willing to take in achieving its strategic objective.

Internal Control

The Companyâ€™s management recognizes the importance of a good internal control system as an important element in the framework of Good Corporate Governance, which helps the Company to achieve its goals and prevent or detect wrong doings.

The Company has established a series of integrated controls, starting with environment control by establishing a strict code of conduct and adopting adherence to its Corporate Values in conducting business.
